parameters.name: abatement-age
parameters.description: Abatement as age or age range

parameters.name: clinical-status
parameters.description: The clinical status of the condition

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the condition record

parameters.name: onset-age
parameters.description: Onsets as age or age range

parameters.name: verification-status
parameters.description: unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error

info.description: Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses
info.title: FHIR R4 Condition Resource

Condition.description: Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses

asserter.description: Individual who is making the condition statement.

bodySite.description: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

category.description: A category assigned to the condition.

clinicalStatus.description: The clinical status of the condition.

code.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

onset[x].description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

recorder.description: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

severity.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

subject.description: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

verificationStatus.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

high.description: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.

low.description: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

author[x].description: The individual responsible for making the annotation.

text.description: The text of the annotation in markdown format.

time.description: Indicates when this particular annotation was made.

div.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant
